Legal_Issue: Whether Hsu met the residency requirement for Canadian citizenship under s. 5(1)(c) of the Citizenship Act
Application_Facts: Hsu was absent from Canada for 976 days and present for only 119 days during the four-year period preceding his application; lived and worked in Taiwan with occasional visits to Canada
Court_Ruling: Hsu did not meet the legal residency requirement for citizenship
Defendant_Behavior: Resided primarily in Taiwan, maintained employment there, and had limited physical presence in Canada
Grounds_for_Claim: Failure to accumulate 1,095 days of physical residence in Canada within the required four-year period
Legal_Standard: Must have at least 1,095 days of residence in Canada within four years before application
Assessment_Factor: Centralized mode of living not established in Canada despite family ties
Procedural_Issue: Trial de novo before Federal Court Trial Division due to appeal timing under pre-1998 rules
Review_Standard: Statutory interpretation and factual assessment under trial de novo standard
Evidence_Used: Record of entries and exits, employment records in Taiwan, duration of stays in Canada
Application_Basis: Accrual of residency days under Canadian citizenship law
Evidence_Assessed: Duration and pattern of physical presence in Canada
Governing_Rule: Applicant must accumulate at least 1,095 days of residence in Canada within four years preceding the application
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Insufficient documentation or proof of physical residence meeting statutory threshold
Outcome: Appeal dismissed; Hsu remains ineligible for citizenship
Cause_Description: Hsu's failure to establish a centralized mode of living in Canada despite having family there
Evidence_Handling: Evaluation of residency patterns based on travel and employment records
Evidence_Issues: Lack of sufficient evidence demonstrating compliance with residency requirement
Residency_Compliance: Not satisfied â€“ only 119 days physically present in Canada
Evidence_Assessment: Factual determination based on official records of presence and absence
Decision_Rationale: The applicant did not fulfill the statutory requirement of 1,095 days of residence and failed to demonstrate that Canada was the center of his daily life
Evidentiary_Issues: Absence of corroborating evidence showing intent to reside in Canada or substantial physical presence
Legal_Standard_Applied: Objective measurement of physical presence and centrality of mode of living
